result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Wedekind was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or training to get full time employment.
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def to undergo Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

9-13-16:  COURT ORDERS TO REMIT ALL COURT COSTS/FEES ON THIS CASE
.
